page.title: 16FARMING IN STUDLAND
page.content: In Studland there are several farms.The average dairy farm in Studland has 48 cows,grassland and several (medium sized)milking parlours.They feed their dairy herd on hay and silage. The size of one farm in Studland,Manor Farm,is 1000 acres.The National Trust owns the Dairy Farms in Studland.The milk is usually sent to Bournemouth for processing. The machinery they use are Harvesters,Tractors,Bailers,Combines and Ploughs. Common Market Regulations affect farmers in Studland in several ways. Several hardships come into farms in Studland especially because of all the traffic coming off the Studland (Sandbanks) ferry. It is diffucult to cross cattle from one field to another because it causes traffic jams.
